body_html:
@pratikac
Thank you for your reply.

Running python train.py -m allcnn --gamma=1e-4 --scoping=1e-3 --noise=1e-4 -B 200 -L 20 with pytorch v0.2.0 on a Titan X (Pascal), I get results like:

Train: [ 0] 0.6048 21.14% [298.86s]
Test: [ 0] 0.3562 12.1964%

Train: [ 1] 0.2279 7.80% [294.37s]
Train: [ 2] 0.1307 4.56% [293.68s]
Train: [ 3] 0.0896 3.09% [298.54s]
Train: [ 4] 0.0684 2.33% [293.65s]
Train: [ 5] 0.0558 1.88% [297.58s]
Test: [ 5] 0.3631 9.5353%

Train: [ 6] 0.0445 1.46% [294.67s]
Train: [ 7] 0.0395 1.34% [298.33s]
Train: [ 8] 0.0348 1.12% [295.30s]
Train: [ 9] 0.0310 1.07% [293.53s]
Train: [10] 0.0289 0.96% [291.89s]
Test: [10] 0.4058 9.6966%

However, before I upgraded pytorch, result of running the same command was like:

Train: [ 0] 1.3807 48.86% [14.19s]
Test: [ 0] 0.9708 33.8474%

Train: [ 1] 0.9442 33.32% [13.62s]
Train: [ 2] 0.8139 28.38% [14.39s]
Train: [ 3] 0.7006 24.22% [13.76s]
Train: [ 4] 0.6254 21.68% [13.71s]
Train: [ 5] 0.5720 19.96% [13.63s]
Test: [ 5] 0.5057 17.4680%

Train: [ 6] 0.5326 18.45% [13.66s]
Train: [ 7] 0.4979 17.38% [13.45s]
Train: [ 8] 0.4722 16.39% [13.73s]
Train: [ 9] 0.4371 15.04% [13.58s]
Train: [10] 0.4100 14.21% [13.96s]
Test: [10] 0.4053 13.7587%

The execution time of v0.2.0 is much slower than v0.1.12.

I cann't find .whl file from pytorch.org for v0.1.12, so I will reinstall v0.1.12 from source and then try to run this command again.

@pratikac
Thank you for your reply.
Running python train.py -m allcnn --gamma=1e-4 --scoping=1e-3 --noise=1e-4 -B 200 -L 20 with pytorch v0.2.0 on a Titan X (Pascal), I get results like:

body:
@pratikac 
Thank you for your reply.

Running `python train.py -m allcnn --gamma=1e-4 --scoping=1e-3 --noise=1e-4 -B 200 -L 20` with pytorch v0.2.0 on a Titan X (Pascal), I get results like:
```
Train: [ 0] 0.6048 21.14% [298.86s]
Test: [ 0] 0.3562 12.1964%

Train: [ 1] 0.2279 7.80% [294.37s]
Train: [ 2] 0.1307 4.56% [293.68s]
Train: [ 3] 0.0896 3.09% [298.54s]
Train: [ 4] 0.0684 2.33% [293.65s]
Train: [ 5] 0.0558 1.88% [297.58s]
Test: [ 5] 0.3631 9.5353%

Train: [ 6] 0.0445 1.46% [294.67s]
Train: [ 7] 0.0395 1.34% [298.33s]
Train: [ 8] 0.0348 1.12% [295.30s]
Train: [ 9] 0.0310 1.07% [293.53s]
Train: [10] 0.0289 0.96% [291.89s]
Test: [10] 0.4058 9.6966%
```
However, before I upgraded pytorch, result of running the same command was like:
```
Train: [ 0] 1.3807 48.86% [14.19s]
Test: [ 0] 0.9708 33.8474%

Train: [ 1] 0.9442 33.32% [13.62s]
Train: [ 2] 0.8139 28.38% [14.39s]
Train: [ 3] 0.7006 24.22% [13.76s]
Train: [ 4] 0.6254 21.68% [13.71s]
Train: [ 5] 0.5720 19.96% [13.63s]
Test: [ 5] 0.5057 17.4680%

Train: [ 6] 0.5326 18.45% [13.66s]
Train: [ 7] 0.4979 17.38% [13.45s]
Train: [ 8] 0.4722 16.39% [13.73s]
Train: [ 9] 0.4371 15.04% [13.58s]
Train: [10] 0.4100 14.21% [13.96s]
Test: [10] 0.4053 13.7587%
```
The execution time of v0.2.0 is much slower than v0.1.12.

I cann't find .whl file from [pytorch.org](http://pytorch.org/) for v0.1.12, so I will reinstall v0.1.12 from source and then try to run this command again.
